title: 115_hr3284
content: The Act titled "Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series Act of 2017" adds a new section to the Homeland Security Act, establishing the Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series. The Administrator, in consultation with the National Counterterrorism Center and the FBI Director, will establish a Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series to address emerging terrorist threats and enhance State and local jurisdictions' ability to prevent, respond to, and recover from attacks. The Workshop Series will review existing plans, policies, and procedures related to terrorist attacks, identify gaps in operational capabilities, and identify resources at the Federal, State, and local levels. The Workshop Series will identify gaps in operational capabilities and resources at Federal, State, and local levels. It will provide assistance through training and exercises to address these gaps, examine roles and responsibilities in the event of a terrorist attack, improve information sharing, and share best practices and lessons learned. The Administrator will select jurisdictions to host the Workshop Series. The Workshop Series will be hosted in cities that have received funding under section 2003 and have requested to be considered. Participants include senior officials, law enforcement, fire and rescue, emergency management, EMS, public health officials, private sector representatives, and others as deemed appropriate. The Administrator will provide reports on the Workshop Series. The Administrator, in consultation with relevant officials, will develop and submit reports after each Workshop Series. The reports will include key findings, lessons learned, best practices, mitigation strategies, and resources to address identified gaps. Annual reports will also be provided starting one year after the enactment of this section. The Administrator, in consultation with relevant officials, will submit annual reports to Congress summarizing key themes, lessons learned, and best practices identified during Workshop Series. $1,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2018 to 2022 for this purpose. Sec. 529. Joint Counterterrorism Awareness Workshop Series. Passed the House of Representatives on September 14, 2017.
